reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fun place this was to stay! We were in Room 205 in a Crash Pad and it was truly eclectic. The room was spotlessly clean and well outfitted.
reviews.title: Great place!

likes.liked: — Room was clean and comfortable - decor was eclectic and fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Considering the entertainment available at the hotel and the great number of people who avail themselves of it, our room was surprisingly quiet.
reviews.title: Great for Sexy Getaway!

reviews.text: The location is a little further west than the downtown/harbor area, but the tram stop is directly across the street so getting around was quite easy. Toronto is not a place you'd choose to drive around in if you didn't have to. While the hotel itself does not have parking, the lot across the street is convenient, safe and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Ok for a 30's middle class ocean liner stateroom

reviews.text: The rooms, the drinks and the food are all a little pricey, but all in all we felt it was a good experience and a great place to stay!
reviews.title: A Unique and Unforgettable Experience

likes.disliked: — It was pricey, but I was not disappointed

reviews.text: We live in Toronto, but wanted to have a sexy, city getaway for our 3rd anniversary. I knew that The Drake was a hip, happening place that I had always intended to visit.
reviews.title: Great style and friendly staff

likes.disliked: — 'Apartment Sized' Ironing board - 2.5 foot with 3 inch legs, like something that fell off an ironing board.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to book a room at The Drake because of all the feedback we got from the reviews. The reviews are pretty much acurate. Clean and really vintage looking but modern at the same time. It's a weird combo that seems to work. We were very excited about being able to come back from a concert and being able to chill and have a drink at one of the 3 facilities/clubs in the hotel... however, sure enough a week before we arrived we got an e-mail saying that all facilities would not be available due to some stupid "green" event. Disapointed is an understatement. What really irked us was that our room was still super expensive without the added benefit of using bars and dining areas.
reviews.title: Really cool place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we feel like giving the place a worst rating we still believe that when all the amenities are available this is probably a great place to hang out. We just feel on a personal level that we got the short end of the stick.
reviews.title: Drake - the culteral hub of Toronto where the service is genuine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great people though at check in! We might give it another chance some day.
reviews.title: A special getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a pleasure it was to experience genuine customer service in action -I felt the staff really wanted to help and were genuinely interested in what we were doing in the city, rather than talking from a script.
reviews.title: My Stay at The Drake in June of 2008

likes.liked: — I loved the bed and the bathroom very much.

reviews.text: The hotel is a great retreat and a culteral hub, offering good food and drink, with fantastic transport links to the tourist attractions, gallarys, museums etc. Although some distance from the centre of Toronto, it is walkable and enables you to get closer to the real vibe of the city.
reviews.title: the total package - great vibe, great room, great sleep!

likes.disliked: — noisy beer delivery outside my window in the morning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Drake Hotel while my partner was here on business.
reviews.title: The Drake was Cake

likes.disliked: — Poor wireless connection in my room (great for others in our group in their rooms)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff here is PHENOMENALLY helpful and friendly (great-looking, too!).
reviews.title: the country wife
No mistake to stay at the Drake!
reviews.text: I mentioned that I wanted to go sightseeing and snip-snap they printed Google maps of locations I wanted to see and highlighted my route for me. They helped me print & fax anytime needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went thrift store shopping, returned to the hotel with my haul and asked for directions to a laundromat -- their manager offered to take my laundry home & do it himself!
reviews.title: Ya gotta love the Drake!
weekend stay at the Drake
reviews.text: I asked for recommendations of hair salons; they offered several and then mentioned that their cafe' manager cuts hair as well. The haircut she gave me is adorable (I'm not making this up)!

reviews.title: For the hip and not the hip replacements
reviews.text: We recently flew to Canada from London, UK to produce an event at the Drake Hotel. As a first "snap shot" of Toronto is was a great starting point. The area is superb, probably the coolest part of Toronto - though i suppose we all have different cool-ometers! bars, restaurants, Trinity Bellwoods park, lots of shopping - it's all there. China town is a 20 minute walk as is Kensington if you are into a taste of Mexico and loads of second hand clothing stores. The experience at the drake could not have been topped. We stayed five nights and were gutted to leave. I think the hotel concept rocks - GREAT decor, amazing staff, cafe, roof top bar, lounge, bar, restaurant, club - all under one roof - all very arty and cultured in my opinion, complete with an artist in residence. Their finger is on the pulse and lots are seeming to follow. We were there on business producing an event called Shoot Toronto.. We ate breakfast at the hotel cafe every morning, used the free WIFI access to death - generally spent a lot of time in the cafe outside on the veranda - there was a heat wave that weekend...

reviews.title: Exceptional Service!
reviews.text: This hotel is for the hip and not the hip replacements. I can't wait to go back. See my blog for more - htttp://www.shootexperience.com/blog

I stayed at the Drake hotel on March 1st, 2007. I just wanted to say that your hotel was fabulous. I will always remeber how wonderful it was because my now fiance asked me to Marry him there! I found the service just amazing. I used to work in the hospitality industry and I really value good service. All of your staff was super friendly and definetly exceeded our expectations. Thank you so much for making one of the most important days in my life even more wonderful!
reviews.title: Once is enough

reviews.text: What a wonderful place - full of beautiful art, interesting people and the staff is outstanding. Being 64 probably makes me a bit older than their average guest, but I would recommend The Drake to everyone. The energy in this hotel is warm and exciting and the people who work there are extremely helpful and fun! The food is delicious and even in The Cafe the presentation is beautiful. And, the neighborhood is full of art galleries and wonderful small shops. I can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Wonderful Energy, Great Service

likes.liked: — The style of the hotel & the amazing front desk people
likes.disliked: — The room could have been a bit bigger

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ann
reviews.title: Toronto didn't disappoint, unlike the Drake...

likes.liked: — The skybar was pleasant enough, and the location - Queen Street West is ace
likes.disliked: — Noisy room, snooty and inefficient staff

reviews.text: We booked the Drake on the basis of the reviews on TripAdvisor, but having spent a week there, I feel like we stayed in a totally different hotel to the rest of the reviewers.
reviews.title: TIFF at the Drake

likes.liked: — High funk factor- first rate staff
likes.disliked: — having to leave my room in the morning for coffee

reviews.text: Firstly, the noise. We were in the previously mentioned room 203. I guess we could've ignored being woken every morning at 7.30am by the awnings on the cafe downstairs being opened. But on the first night there was an art event in Toronto called Nuit Blanche, which apparently is a great excuse to pump loud house music into your room until the police arrive at 4.40am to break things up. I rang down at 3.20am to find out how much longer it would last (and informed it'd only be another 20 minutes or so - I'm guessing the 'or so' meant 'add another hour on to that) and request ear plugs, only to be told that they had no earplugs, that there wasn't anything they could do and not actually hear the word 'sorry'. Had we have had some warning or an apology, we'd probably have been fine about it, but with none forthcoming, it was a hardly an auspicious start to our stay. On our last night, mindful of having an overnight flight we went to bed a bit early (midnightish), but at two am had to check the room wasn't being broken into because of the noise of the bar opposite kicking out - believe me, it's not quiet. I do not believe for a second that we're the only ones to complain about the noise in the room if that's the norm.
reviews.title: Beyond 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next, the room. Now it's small, and I appreciate that they're trying to create an illusion of space. The problem comes when to compensate, you need to be the kind of couple who don't mind using the toilet in front of each other, because the toilet (and shower) are glass. Granted, there's a bit of frosting on the toilet door, but you are aware that your loved one is mere centimetres away, and I'm more one for keeping a certain amount of mystery, myself.
reviews.title: Coolest Hotel we´ve ever been!!
